Spiders.synopsis: Non-critpath. Two giant spiders trap the player. The one that shoots the web is female. Her companion is her brother.  The player has a chance to convince the spiders they are friendly, setting the spiders loose on the goblins in the camp above.

Adventurer.synopsis: an adventurer who survived being thrown into the goblins' spider pit

Spiders_CantSpeak.synopsis: Two giant spiders trap the player. Normally, the player has a chance to convince the spiders they are friendly, setting the spiders loose on the goblins in the camp above. But in this case, the player is unable to speak and can't make their case.

CapturedGoblin.synopsis: Sazza after she survives 'execution' the the spider pit. Pleading to the player to let her leave (which she will if she's not killed)

Spiders_11.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders_11.text: Yes, my desire. Closer, my sweet!
Spiders_11.context: NodeContext: Excited, drooling with desire to eat us.

Spiders_25.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders_25.text: I will wrap you, and bind you, and bite you, and eat you.
Spiders_25.context: NodeContext: Excited, almost to herself, thinking about how she'll eat us

Spiders_40.speaker: Player
Spiders_40.text: You'd get sick if you ate me. I carry a strange curse.

Spiders_50.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders_50.text: I see your sickness. A poison in the skull. Do not touch me, do not come close.

Spiders_48.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders_48.text: I do not get sick. I wrap. I bind. I bite. I eat.
Spiders_48.context: NodeContext: anxious but hungry and aggressive

Spiders_29.speaker: Player
Spiders_29.text: You should eat a goblin instead. They're delicious.

Spiders_18.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders_18.text: Delicious - I do not know. But cruel and sharp - yes. Bindable and wrappable and biteable - yes.
Spiders_18.context: NodeContext: delighted, preparing to escape and feast on goblins who have held it captive

Spiders_52.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders_52.text: More delicious than you? More bindable? More wrappable? More biteable? No.
Spiders_52.context: NodeContext: considering the question, then a happy malicious 'no' as she prepares to eat us

Spiders_5.speaker: Narrator
Spiders_5.context: InternalNodeContext: |SCRIPTER: Spiders are hostile to the player. The player is NOT caught in a web.|

Spiders_13.speaker: Player
Spiders_13.text: How dare you. Do you not recognise me? Lolth, Queen of Spiders.

Spiders_28.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders_28.text: Lolth? Is it... you? My queen! My queen of biting. My queen of binding. My queen of wrapping and holding. What would you have me do?
Spiders_28.context: NodeContext: Lolth is her goddess. We just tricked her into thinking we ARE that goddess so she's in awe. The second L on 'lolth' isn't silent. The O can be long (lowlth) or short (lawlth

Spiders_14.speaker: Player
Spiders_14.text: Kill the goblins. They displease me.

Spiders_47.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders_47.context: NodeContext: obedient and in awe, thinking she's speaking to her goddess

Spiders_46.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders_46.text: Open the door so I can do your bidding.
Spiders_46.context: NodeContext: eager and in awe, thinks she's speaking to her goddess

Spiders_49.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders_49.text: Their blood will sicken from my bite.
Spiders_49.context: CinematicNodeContext: |SCRIPTER: Spiders are friendly to player. They leave the pit to attack the goblins.|NodeContext: malicious and delighted as she prepares to leave and eat her captors

Spiders_2.speaker: Player
Spiders_2.text: Tell me more about this place.

Spiders_26.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders_26.text: There is another drow here, but she has forgotten you, my queen. She is forsaken.
Spiders_26.context: NodeContext: describing a blasphemy - thinks she's speaking to her goddess

Spiders_20.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders_20.context: NodeContext: obedient and in awe, thinking she's speaking to her goddess

Spiders_39.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders_39.context: NodeContext: Confused - Lolth is her goddess. For Lolth - the second L isn't silent. The O can be long (lowlth) or short (lawlth

Spiders_17.speaker: Narrator
Spiders_17.text: *Suddenly, a suffocating wave of divine rage surges through the spider pit.*

Spiders_4.speaker: Narrator
Spiders_4.text: *It hadn't occurred to you that Lolth might be listening.*

Spiders_3.speaker: Narrator
Spiders_3.text: *Shaking with the goddess' fury, the spider shrieks, then attacks.*
Spiders_3.context: InternalNodeContext: |SCRIPTER: Spiders are hostile to the player. The player is NOT caught in a web.|

Spiders_22.speaker: Narrator
Spiders_22.text: *The spider seems poised to attack, but she hesitates, tapping her claws as if trying to communicate.*

Spiders_43.speaker: Narrator
Spiders_43.context: CinematicNodeContext: *The other spider echoed her, tapping his claws gleefully.*

Spiders_33.speaker: Player
Spiders_33.text: Clap your hands together, mimicking her movements.

Spiders_38.speaker: Narrator
Spiders_38.text: *The spider relaxes slightly, but you feel her hunger - and fear - beneath the surface.*

Spiders_45.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player gestures toward the exit

Spiders_10.speaker: Narrator
Spiders_10.text: *She looks to the closed door, drooling.*

Spiders_35.speaker: Narrator
Spiders_35.text: *The sound and your movement agitate her. She prepares to strike.*

Spiders_44.speaker: Narrator
Spiders_44.context: InternalNodeContext: |SCRIPTER: Combat with the spiders begins. Player is not caught in a web.|

Spiders_37.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders_37.text: Gone, spoiled meat. Gone from here.
Spiders_37.context: NodeContext: disgusted, wanted to eat us but thinks we're poisoned

Spiders_53.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders_53.text: What would you have me do?
Spiders_53.context: NodeContext: obedience and awe, thinking she's speaking ot her goddess

Spiders_Wildshape_3.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders_Wildshape_3.text: |We generally eat people and other animals that end up here|

Spiders_Wildshape_0.speaker: Smaller Giant Spider
Spiders_Wildshape_0.text: |Eated! Eated! Is it eated or eaten, sis?|

Spiders_Wildshape_10.speaker: Player
Spiders_Wildshape_10.text: |But wait! Goblins are so much tastier and with our animal forces combined, we can get a feast unlike anything you had!|

Spiders_Wildshape_22.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders_Wildshape_22.text: |At least you recognize us as animals. Refreshing!|

Spiders_Wildshape_17.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders_Wildshape_17.text: |But the cage gate is closed and we cannot leave right now. Open it and feast shall be ours|

Spiders_Wildshape_23.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders_Wildshape_23.text: |*Spiders scurry away towards the open cage gate*|

Spiders_Wildshape_19.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders_Wildshape_19.text: |But why tho? We can have a feast right here right now. Again, prepare to get eated.|

Spiders_Wildshape_20.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders_Wildshape_20.text: |You must be new here. Care for a tour of our place?|

Spiders_Wildshape_26.speaker: Player
Spiders_Wildshape_26.text: |We should attack goblins! They are tasty!|

Adventurer_0.speaker: Smythin
Adventurer_0.text: Thanks. I thought I was done for.

Spiders_CantSpeak_0.speaker: Narrator
Spiders_CantSpeak_0.text: *The spider seems poised to attack, but she hesitates, tapping her claws as if trying to communicate.*

Spiders_CantSpeak_1.speaker: Narrator
Spiders_CantSpeak_1.text: *You, however, are unable to speak. Her hesitation turns to impatience.*
Spiders_CantSpeak_1.context: NodeContext: Starts combat, the spider lunges.

CapturedGoblin_0.speaker: Sazza
CapturedGoblin_0.text: Let me go. I'll sneak off and become a hermit - won't cause trouble for nobody.
CapturedGoblin_0.context: NodeContext: pleading; just survived an attempted execution
